channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Caravan blocking shared access of driveway, 31st August
item.description:
The owners of 7a Lears drive have left for over 2 months there caravan on the drive. The end section is shared access and they have kept this constantly blocked by leaving it there. Also there is a convergent stopping caravans being stored there only for short time to load and unload
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6,7, Lears Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Circa 12 inch pothole and broken road around it and the adjacent road gulley. The road gulley is also blocked and needs clearing., 30th August
item.description:
The pothole and road gulley is outside the property named Tanglewood on New Road (GL52 3NX). The problem has been previously reported 4-6 weeks ago and is getting worse. It’s becoming dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General rubbish dump in a small triangle grass section, 30th August
item.description:
Small grass area on side of road, full of litter that has been there for ages with no attempt to be cleared , health hazard and very unsightly. Needs clearing .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13-17, Cobham Court, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of corrugated cardboard, 30th August
item.description:
Black corrugated cardboard has been stuffed behind the actual Everest Road road sign on the corner with Old Bath Rd. It's been there for several weeks, having possibly been left behind by the gas workers/drainage workers when the road was actually closed for several weeks in recent months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 254, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole length of the A40, is a litter tip awful message and the one bin provided halfway down was over flowing ., 30th August
item.description:
Whole length of the golden valley bypass is full of litter on grass verges, central reservation , it’s a disgrace - provide more bins-the only one provided half way down is overflowing and bags placed nearby, some of that litter has been displaced by weather, large canisters had rolled into road, . This mess needs clearing up asap as dangerous to drivers and wildlife who dare to try and cross the road . Come on council - pull your finger out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winston Road, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road repair to granite sets, 30th August
item.description:
The tarmac repair to the loose granite sets strip on Lobleys Drive is insufficient and collapsing. This is resulting in a sharp lip developing, which could become dangerous enough to cause a puncture. There is no way to avoid it as it is directly at the apex of the corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags still not removed from lamp posts, 30th August
item.description:
I made a complaint a week ago about this and still the flags are on the lamp posts in the central reservation, distracting drivers and making the local community feel unsafe. It is an offence to fix anything to a lamp post and I expect the people who put them up can be identified through the numerous CCTV cameras in the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The hedge is overgrown, 30th August
item.description:
The hedge has not been trimmed for the past three months. This issue occurs every year and no action is ever taken to resolve it. The situation poses a safety risk, as when two vehicles pass each other, their mirrors and bodywork are scratched due to being forced into contact with the overgrown hedge. Immediate maintenance is required to prevent further damage and ensure road safety
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
